result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon T. Aide was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Transfer (>$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With work release and 0 days credit.

Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational programs ordered by agent.  Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  (If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon T. Aide in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead as charged for imposed/stayed sentence with 9 mo jail and 3 years probation, conditions to include assts, treatment and costs.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  9 months jail, imposed/stayed for probation of 3 years with conditions that he attend, complete, pay for any educational programs; pay costs.  No request or order for restitution.  Costs as an order of probation.  Def to submit DNA sample when he reports to jail.

Defendant Brandon T. Aide in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Additional status requested and set; likely resolution.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Brandon T. Aide. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Time limits have been waived for prelim. Reset for status.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant  to submit to booking/printing at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Brandon T. Aide in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Charges stated.  Rights stated.  Prelim time limits waived.  Def presently in custody of Iowa County; will be transferred to Dane Co. for matter there.  Status requested and set.  July 15 at 2:30 for status.

DA requests 5k signature bond with booking requirement.  So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
